glsa.title: Kaffeine: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: Kaffeine is vulnerable to a buffer overflow that could lead to the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Kaffeine is a graphical front-end for the xine-lib multimedia library.

description.p: Kaffeine uses an unchecked buffer when fetching remote RAM playlists via HTTP.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to play a specially-crafted RAM playlist resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Kaffeine users should upgrade to the latest version:

references.uri: KDE Security Advisory: Kaffeine buffer overflow
